intro: Pleurothallis sanjanae, commonly known as the Sanjanae orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of South America. This small epiphytic plant typically grows on trees and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves that help it conserve moisture in its natural habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
